000070392-d-11-12-09-CSX.Narrative: Y32311 LEFT THEIR CABOOSE ON MAINLINE UNATTENDED ON #2 TRACK TO SERVICE THE NABISCO INDUSTRY. Y32311 DID NOT PERFORM THE REQUIRED BRAKE TEST TO INSURE THE CABOOSE WAS PROPERLY SECURED BEFORE LEAVING EQUIPMENT UNATTENDED. Y32311 MADE A CUT ON THE CABOOSE AND PROCEEDED TO WORK THE NABISCO INDUSTRY.THE CABOOSE SAT FOR APPROXIMATELY 20 MINUTES THEN BEGAN TO ROLL IN A WESTWARD DIRECTION. Y32311 WASMOVING WEST FROM NABISCO TO #2 MAIN WITH THEIR TRAIN WHILE H77511 WAS ALSO MOVING IN A WESTWARD DIRECTION ON #1 TRACK. THE ROLLING CABOOSE MADE SIDE IMPACT WITH Y32311 AND DERAILED ON NORTH SIDE OF #2 MAIN AND MADE A SIDE IMPACT WITH PASSING TRAIN H77511.

213738-d-11-01-09-SOO.Narrative: 298-29 DERAILED A TOTAL OF 14 LOADED GRAIN HOPPERS CARS (POSITION 67 THROUGH 80) WHILE CROSSING OVERFROM SOO #1MAIN TRACK TO UP #2 MAIN TRACK AT SHERMER (ES ADVISES SOO NUMBERS THEIR TRACKS OPPOSITEFROM WHAT UP NUMBERS THEIR TRACKS), DERAILING INTO REAR 4 EMPTY CARS OF 487-04  (POSITION 68 THROUGH71) THAT WAS STOPPED ON SOO #2 MAIN TRACK AT TECHNEY ROAD. SOO/CP MILEPOST LOCATION T-1.0, JOINTEDRAIL.  UP MILEPOST LOCATION 17.5.  UP REPORTS $680,818 TRACK DAMAGES. CP HAS DETERMINED THE PRIMARYCAUSE OF THE DERAILMENT OF CPS TRAIN ON UP TRACKAGE AT SHERMER TO BE TRACK RELATED, WITH CAUSE T101,UNEVEN TRACK - LOW JOINTS, WITH A SECONDARY CAUSE E46C ASSOCIATED WITH SOME POSSIBLE BINDING OF THECENTER PLATE ON THE CAR. UPS TRACK MEASUREMENTS DID NOT SHOW ANY FRA TRACK DEFECTS; HOWEVER, IT DOES NOT APPEAR THAT THEIR MEASUREMENTS WERE ACTUALLY TAKEN UNDER LOAD.  CP TRAIN CREWS WERE NOT USED IN SPOTTING EQUIPMENT TO FACILITATE MEASUREMENT TAKING FOR THE LOADED CONDITION BY UP. AND DUE TO DERAILMENT TRACK DAMAGE, THE CP ROUTE WAS THE ONLY AVAILABLE MEANS TO REPOSITION EQUIPMENT FOR TAKING MEASUREMENTS IN A LOADED STATE. WE HAVE ALSO CONFIRMED THAT HULCHERS WRECKING EQUIPMENT WAS NOT USEDTO REPOSITION CARS FOR THE PURPOSE OF TAKING TRACK MEASUREMENTS BY UP. WHEN ASKED HOW LOADED MEASUREMENTS WERE OBTAINED, NO RESPONSE WAS PROVIDED BY UP. CP TOOK CROSSLEVEL MEASUREMENTS AT SELECTED POINTS (APPROXIMATELY 45 BEFORE, 15 BEFORE AND AT THE POD) WHILE CARS WERE OCCUPYING THE TRACK (I.

302-d-11-17-09-GRS.Primary Accident Cause: Other miscellaneous causes (Provide detailed description in narrative)
302-d-11-17-09-GRS.Accident Cause: Other miscellaneous causes (Provide detailed description in narrative)
302-d-11-17-09-GRS.Narrative:
WHILE HAULING THE TRAIN THROUGH NASHUA NH IN THE AREA OF BRIDGE STREET THE TRAIN DUMPED ITS AIR FROMTHE TAIL END THE CONDUCTOR WALKED BACK AND FOUND CARS 77,78,79,80,81,82 DERAILED. THE RESULTS FOR THE CAUSE WAS AS FOLLOWS. CAR 
NW 132509 WAS A MAJOR CAUSE FOR THIS DERAILMENT FOR THE FOLLOWING REASONS. THE CAR IS OVERAGE BUILT 7/1969 WITH NO REBUILD OR EXTENDED LIFE STATUS. THERE IS SEVERE CORROSION THROUGH THE SLOPE SHEET TO THE HOPPER CONNECTIONS, LARGE HOLES CORRODED THROUGH, AT ALL LOCATIONS. THIS EFFECTS THE STRUCTURAL INTEGRITY OF THE LOAD. THERE ARE FRESH WHEEL BURN MARKS ON THE NORTHEND OF THIS CAR INDICATING THAT THE BODY OF THE CAR HAD IN FACT COME IN CONTACT WITH THE WHEELS, WHILE THE CAR WAS IN MOTION. THIS WOULD RESTRICT TRUCK SWIVEL AND CAUSE UNDUE LATERAL STRESS ON THE RAIL HEAD CAUSING THE HIGH SIDE RAIL IN THE CURVE TO ROLL OUT. THE NORTH END OF THIS CAR HAS INSUFFICIENT SIDE BEARING CLEARANCE PER AAR INTERCHANGE RULES AGAIN RESTRICTING TRUCK SWIVEL. IN ADDITION ITWAS DISCOVERED DURING THE INVESTIGATION THAT NUMEROUS CARS IN THIS TRAIN WERE LOADED IMPROPERLY. THECARS WERE LOADED HEAVY ON THE NORTH END AND LITE ON THE SOUTH END. THIS WAS ALSO IN OUR INVESTIGATION ON 11/23/09 BY FRA INSPECTOR MATT RAYLINSKY.

000070287-d-11-11-09-CSX.Narrative: Q20811 WAS HEADING TOWARD THE NORTH END OF CHESTER. AS THE TRAIN PROGRESSED THROUGH C01 AND OUT THENORTH END SWITCH, THE ENGINEER NOTICED THE ENGINE LOADING UP. HE THEN NOTICED THE ENGINE BEGINNING TO JUMP FORWARD AND SAW THE MOTOR LOADING UP EVEN MORE, AT THAT POINT HE STOPPED THE TRAIN AND CALLEDSTATING HE WAS UNABLE TO PULL THE TRAIN. UPON ARRIVAL IT WAS DETERMINED A 3 TO 4 FOOT SECTION OF RAIL HAD COME OUT. IT WAS ALSO DETERMINED THAT WHEN THE CARS GOT TO THE NORTH END OF C01 THE SWITCH CAUSED TWO OF THE CARS TO SHIFT TOWARDS THE OLD MAIN ENOUGH TO COME INTO CONTACT WITH 3 CARS OF THE R61711.

THE CUT OF CARS WAS THEN SHOVED APPROXIMATELY 20 CARS BEFORE MOVEMENT WAS STOPPED BY THE DERAILMENT.  INVESTIGATION REVEALED THAT TWO OF THE CARS IN THE CUT HAD BYPASSED COUPLERSAND THE LATERAL FORCE FROM THE BYPASS ROLLED THE RAIL RESULTING IN 10 CARS BEING DERAILED.

653667-d-11-23-09-EJE.Narrative: L51391-23 WAS SHOVING WESTBOUND WHEN A DUMP TRUCK PULLED IN FRONT OF THE TRAIN AT THE CROSSING.  DRIVER THEN STOPPED THE TRUCK WITH THE REAR OF THE TRUCK FOULING THE TRACK TO APOLOGIZE FOR BEATING THETRAIN.  CONDUCTOR WAS RIDING THE POINT AND DISMOUNTED BEFORE THE LEAD CAR, PROX 61041, STRUCK THE TRUCK.  NO INJURIES WERE REPORTED.  CROSSING WAS MARKED WITH CROSSBUCKS AND YIELD SIGNS.  PROX 61041(LEAD CAR) MADE CONTACT WITH THE END OF THE DUMP TRUCK RESULTING IN DAMAGE TO THE "A" END PLATFORM AND DAMAGE TO THE SIDE OF THE CAR.  MATERIAL IN THE TANK WAS LOADED SULFUR, UPON INSPECTION NO BREACHOF CONTAINER WAS FOUND.  NO INJURY RESULTED DUE TO THE INCIDENT AND MINOR DAMAGE TO THE REAR PASSENGER SIDE OF THE DUMP TRUCK.  NO TRACK DAMAGE.  NO LEAKS OR INJURIES REPORTED WITH THIS ACCIDENT.

000070135-d-11-06-09-CSX.Narrative: DURING NORMAL HUMP OPERATIONS THE AEX 6531 STALLED AT THE SOUTH END OF C16.  THE UTLX 67821 WAS THENHUMPED INTO C16 AND BUMPED THE AEX 6531. AT THIS POINT NOTHING WAS SIDESWIPED, BUT THE UTLX 67821 WAS FOULING THE LEAD. THE PRO-YARD SHOWED THAT THE LEAD INTO C09 WAS CLEAR. CARS WERE EVENTUALLY HUMPED INTO C09 AND SIDESWIPED THE UTLX 67821. THE YARDMASTER NOTICED THE CARS HITTING AND STOPPED HUMPOPERATIONS. FOUR EMPTY COVERED HOPPERS SIDESWIPED THE UTLX 67821 LOADED TANK CAR. THERE WAS NO TRACKDAMAGE.

000070261-d-11-10-09-CSX.Narrative: Y20510 DERAILED FOUR CARS DUE TO IMPROPERLY LINED SWITCH.

000070146-d-11-06-09-CSX.Narrative: Y30105 WENT INTO E00 TRACK AND TIED ON TO 12 CARS AT THE WEST END OF THE TRACK AND SHOVED THOSE CARSEAST TWENTY CAR LENGTHS TO TIE ONTO ANOTHER 21 CARS. ONCE THIS TIE WAS MADE THE CONDUCTOR WALKED TOTHE REAR OF THE TRAIN AND LACED AIR HOSES. WHILE THE Y30105 MADE THIS MOVE THE Y21105 DEPARTED OFFOF TRACK E07.  WHEN THE Y30105 REACHED THE REAR OF HIS TRAIN HE ASKED THE YARDMASTER TO HAVE THE CARDEPARTMENT BRING HIM AND EOT TO HANG ON THE REAR OF THE TRAIN. AFTER HANGING THE EOT THE CONDUCTORINSTRUCTED THE ENGINEER TO PULL AHEAD, OUT OF THE SCALE TRACK AND UP THE LEAD TO DROP THEIR GRIPS OFF SO THEY DID NOT HAVE TO CARRY THEM AS FAR. ON THE WAY UP THE LEAD THE ENGINEER FAILED TO SEE THATTHE E07 SWITCH HAD BEEN CHANGED AND WAS NOW LINED AGAINST HIS MOVE. HE COMPLETED THE MOVE AND RAN THRU THE E07 SWITCH. CONDUCTOR WENT BACK TO THE REAR OF THE TRAIN TO PROTECT THE SHOVE BACK INTO THE SCALE TRACK. HE GAVE THE ENGINEER THE COMMAND TO BACK THE TRAIN INTO THE CLEAR ON E00 TRACK. Y30105 REVERSED THRU A SWITCH THAT THEY RAN THRU AND DERAILED 3 CARS.
